transcript.text: [Music]
[Music]
you
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is david's episode 1322 a
and today's date is July 3rd 2017 and
the title of the episode is all the
economic collapse pieces are falling
into place let's get into the economic
collapse financial news now as we are
moving further and further into this
year we can see that there are many
aspects of the economy that are really
not doing well and I'm going to say this
once again I've said it since I started
you need to get prepared for what is
coming because what we're seeing right
now is a complete breakdown of the
system I mean think about it just a year
ago or two years ago they were out there
telling us how great the recovery was
going manual manufacturing was telling
us how great car sales were how great
housing was how fantastic retail was
doing online sales as incredible and
fast-forward to today
everything is just completely breaking
down now everything that I just said
that was being reported on the corporate
media that was being reported by the Fed
by the government at the time and we
were looking at it saying well no it
looks kind of like the opposite of what
they're saying it doesn't look like
things are doing well it doesn't look
like the auto manufacturers are actually
doing well and when we looked into the
numbers and look what they were doing we
saw that they were channel stuffing and
then we realize what they're doing is
they're producing a lot of cars which
makes manufacturing look a lot better
and every time they delivered a car to a
dealership lot they counted that as a
sale and they continually did this to
make us believe that car sales were
doing fantastic then they also added
incentives they allowed subprime people
to come in to move those cars later on
could they move all of the cars no the
Lots stayed full and what we're seeing
right now is that GM is reporting its
june results
which again are disappointing they're
down 4.7% more than the expected 3.4
percent decline now what we're seeing
here is that chevy GMC Buick Cadillac
we're looking at sales that are down by
negative six point four percent negative
three point six percent negative eleven
point eight percent and the situation is
not getting any better if we look at the
channel stuffing we see GM's channel
stuffing just hit a new all-time high
and what does this mean well the number
of cars that are on the lot right now
are the highest since the summer before
the recession officially began in 2008
now GM Ford Chrysler they posted year on
your sales decline of about six percent
on average and we can see at this point
that the automobile manufacturing
industry it is turned downward and it's
get it's not getting better it's getting
a lot worse when we turn to housing and
we look at construction spending well
this does not look good at all the Econo
de consensus well they expected a bounce
in May for construction spending but the
only bounce was in April and the only
reason they had a bounce in April is
because they revised a number from
negative 1.4 to negative 0.7% May well
nothing happened and what we're seeing
right now is that residential
construction spending is down 0.6%
overall and this includes declines in
single-family homes residential
improvements especially in multifamily
units and in the past we saw
construction spending moving up
everything has turned around right now
and what we're starting to realize is
when you cannot keep the illusion alive
when you don't have those individuals in
government in the Fed manipulating these
numbers things start to fall apart and
this is what we're seeing in the
government right now where a lot of
these individuals while they're gone
and the illusion is falling apart right
in front of our eyes it's almost like
Obamacare when Obama was in office he
had the ability to create the illusion
by moving funds around by manipulating
the numbers letting everyone know how
great it was that 1820 million people
were joining and of course a lot of
those individuals were already had
insurance a lot of the people were on
Medicaid and while you're in office
you're able to manipulate the entire
thing once you leave office and a lot of
these people leave and you can't
manipulate these numbers you see the
real truth shine through and you see it
completely collapse on itself and this
is why as these insurers get wind of
what's really happening and they're
seeing that all these you know coops
they're closing left and right there's
only like four left because they're out
there saying we don't want to be in this
now what's very interesting is that
manufacturing really has gone nowhere we
haven't brought back manufacturing as of
yet yes Trump is planning on doing this
because he needs to do this for the
reset of the country we need
manufacturing in this country we cannot
survive on a service industry and what's
very interesting about this is the
corporate media well they're all over
the place now we have two stories coming
out about manufacturing today and one is
from market and they're saying that the
June report on US manufacturing said
that manufacturing growth weakens again
in June now this is coming from chief
economist Chris Williamson saying that
manufacturers reported disappointing end
to the second quarter with few signs of
growth picking up anytime soon usually
market is pretty darn close to what is
really happening in the economy then we
have Bloomberg and of course they come
out with this article in other corporate
media's outlets they pick up on this
article now Bloomberg came out and their
article reads manufacturing pick up in
us signals boost to economic growth
now we have two opposite things that are
out there today and they're saying that
American factories powered up in June at
the fastest pace in nearly three years
production orders employment all
thriving really how possibly can this be
happening the automobile industry which
is a lot of the manufacturing in this
country is channel stuffing the
dealership lots now the dealership lots
they are at their peak automobile
manufacturers they're not producing as
much as they were before actually that
is declining right now so one of these
stories is completely fake and we kind
of know which one it is but what this
shows us is that they're all over the
place and we can see that they can't
make heads or tails of what's really
going on anymore because remember a lot
of their stories they don't come from
investigating anything a lot of their
information comes from the intelligence
community it comes from the deep state
they tell them what to put out there
they tell them to spit in the headlines
and things are basically breaking down
right now we see out in Silicon Valley
while things are beginning to crack out
there and Wolff Richter he is reporting
that the Silicon Valley commercial real
estate
well it's barely hanging on and there
are parts where it has let go already
and he's saying on the great American
Parkway there are so many offices that
are for lease right now it's absolutely
ridiculous and from a year ago it is up
19% and there are just so many empty
buildings and he shows all these
different pictures of these buildings
just standing there completely empty
saying yes we're ready to lease and it
looks like the shrubs around it or
overgrown they can't move them and this
is just the beginning because what we're
seeing is a complete breakdown of
everything and just yesterday reported
on how Jersey Connecticut Maine Illinois
and many other states they're all having
and it's just getting worse and worse as
time goes on when we look at Illinois we
can see they're trying to raise the tax
rate they're trying to raise the
corporate income tax rate and this is
just going to force a lot of people out
of the state it's going to force a lot
of companies out of state we already see
in Connecticut and this is not going to
help the situation and I know the
governor is out there saying listen I'll
pass this but it has to be a temporary
tax hike because he doesn't want to put
the burden on the Illinois people you
know what happens when they pass these
things it is never temporary yes they
say that in the beginning but what
happens it becomes permanent because
once they start taking those funds you
don't want to give it up so what we're
seeing right now is the beginning of the
end we're seeing things break down
state-by-state pensions are in trouble
the automobile manufacturers are in
trouble
retail is in trouble and you have to
remember this entire country the
recovery that we've been talking about
they based all these jobs on these
part-time
retail food industry jobs that were
created during this entire period now we
see this retail food industry area it is
completely breaking down and people are
losing hundreds of thousands of jobs the
whole thing is completely falling apart
all the pieces to this economic collapse
puzzle they're all coming together think
about right now go back three years ago
at the height of the illusion where they
blew the bubbles up or they were blowing
the bubbles up with stimulus telling you
how great things were and people were
feeling great even though we knew it was
a complete illusion three years - now
look how everything has changed
when you can't keep the manipulation up
when the manipulation fails the truth
always comes through it doesn't matter
if the stock market is that 50,000
points think about it if the stock
market's at 50,000 points
and we have strip malls that are empty
we have moles that are empty we have
people instead of 46 million people we
have a hundred and thirty million people
on food stamps and we have retail stores
that are closing in droves and
corporations that are laying off people
it doesn't really matter if the market
goes to a hundred thousand because at
this point people will stop believing
and once they stop believing everything
falls apart and we are headed to that
period this is what happened pretty much
approaching 2008 now everyone thought
well subprime is contained there's no
problems in the economy the housing
market can't go down the stock market at
that time was at 14,000 points the
highest it's ever been people thought
this could last forever people were
still purchasing homes
1 2 3 4 homes and trying to rent them
out people were still flipping at this
point and then all of a sudden things
started to change people stopped
believing because in the real economy
during this period period leading up to
the stock market crash there were
corporations laying off like crazy
people were just out of work and
interest rates were moving up and people
can afford their homes because they lost
their jobs and they can't make the
payments they couldn't rent out the
houses anymore that they purchased
because people didn't have that type of
funds anymore everything started to fall
apart and it was a chain reaction
companies were falling apart this is
what we're seeing right now this is the
lead-up to the big crash to put this in
perspective think one of those balloons
you ever have one of those balloons
where it's really hard to blow up and it
takes you a very long time well that was
the illusion they were creating that was
the bubbles they were creating they were
blowing up these bubbles very hard to do
and it took
one year two year you got the balloon
1/4 way full 3 years 4 years it's
halfway full 5 years 6 years 7 years
it's almost full
now take a pin this is the crash stick
it into the balloon how fast does it
take to deflate the balloon takes a
second a millisecond it took many many
minutes and if you convert that into
years many years to blow it up it only
takes one needle 1 Black Swan the people
not believing anymore to bring the whole
thing down that's where we're at right
now and the whole entire system is going
to come crashing down and there's
nothing we can do you can't stop it
there's too much debt people don't have
the funds people being laid off all over
the place there are more and more moles
that are becoming empty strip malls that
are becoming empty commercial real
estate where there's a lot of leases out
there a lot of people at the height of
the bubble right now are trying to sell
their homes and they're scratching their
head saying why is it taking so long I
don't understand this those individuals
that are getting laid off from work are
saying how come I can't find that job
something doesn't make sense those
people that just got these new jobs are
wondering why they were just laid off
the whole thing is starting to fall
apart the whole thing is coming down
this is why you need to get prepared
this is why you need to get ready
because we're going to go we're going to
be going through this period of time
where it's not going to be pleasant and
you need to have food you need to have
water you need to have supplies to get
by to get through this reset and once
you do and you put everything in order
and you're prepared for this with gold
silver maybe you're buying crypto
currencies cash on hand protecting your
wealth protecting your family you'll
come out on the other end a lot better
off especially a lot better off than
those people that didn't prepare
all I mean think about it go back to the
30s all those individuals that didn't
turn in their gold that kept their gold
and got more and more gold and hid it
away those individuals made out a lot
better than those who turned it in and
we're going to have the same thing today
those that are prepared are going to be
better off than those who are not so get
prepared
listen everyone thanks a lot for
listening be well be safe and especially
be prepared thanks a lot
[Music]
you
you
